content: तीर्थं [तॄ-थक् <ls>Uṇ. 2. 7</ls>] {@--1@} A passage, road, way, ford. {@--2@} A descent into a river, the stairs of a landingplace; (<ab>Mar.</ab> घाट); विषमोपि विगाह्यते नयः कृततीर्थः पयसामिवाशयः <ls>Ki. 2. 3.</ls> (where तीर्थ means ‘a remedy or means also); तीर्थं सर्वविद्यावताराणां <ls>K. 44.</ls> {@--3@} A place of water. {@--4@} A holy place, place of pilgrimage, a shrine &c, dedicated to some holy object (especially on or near the bank of a sacred river &c.); शुचि मनो यद्यस्ति तर्थिन किं <ls>Bh. 2. 55</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 85.</ls> {@--5@} A channel, medium, means; तदनेन तीर्थेन घटेत &c. <ls>Māl. 1.</ls> {@--6@} A remedy, expedient. {@--7@} A sacred or holy personage, worthy person, an object of veneration, a fit recipient; क्व पुनस्तादृशस्य तीर्थस्य साधोः संभवः <ls>U. 1</ls>; <ls>Ms. 3. 136</ls>; <ls>H. 2. 8</ls>, <ls>R. 5. 15.</ls> {@--8@} A sacred preceptor, a teacher; मया तीर्थादभिनयविद्या शिक्षिता <ls>M. 1.</ls> {@--9@} Source, origin. {@--10@} A sacrifice. {@--11@} A minister. {@--12@} Advice, instruction. {@--13@} Right place or moment. {@--14@} The right or usual manner. {@--15@} Certain parts of the hand sacred to deities, Manes &c. {@--16@} A school of philosophy. {@--17@} Pudendum muliebre. {@--18@} Menstrual courses of a woman. {@--19@} A Brāhmaṇa. {@--20@} (In liturgical language) The path to the altar between the चात्वाल and उत्कर q. <ab>q. v.</ab> v. {@--21@} Fire. {@--22@} Ascertainment of a disease. {@--23@} A science (शास्त्र). {@--24@} An auxiliary, a help; a person or official connected with the king and being in close attendance on him; (the number being 15 on one's side and 18 on the enemy's side); <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Pt. 3. 69.</ls> --र्थः An honorary affix added to the names of ascetics, saints &c.; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} आनंदतीर्थ.
